channel.title: Posts on Andrew Jorgensen
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Andrew Jorgensen

item.title: Signing Git Commits With Keybase
item.description: Signing your commits is a good practice that applies your John Hancock to your work so that others can verify that it was really you made the change, plus you get a cool Verified badge on GitHub and who doesn’t like badges. Managing private keys can be a tricky process but fortunately keybase greatly simplifies this and allows us to easily share keys between different machines.

item.title: A Tale of Two Pipes
item.description: Let me first introduce you to two leading characters: STDIN and STDOUT

item.title: Install homebrew to your home directory
item.description: NOTE: This method of installation is no longer supported but I will leave the post here for posterity. The issues that this was meant to solve have since been fixed by homebrew. You can visit the homebrew website for current installation instructions.

item.title: How to not leak your credentials to the internet
item.description: Sharing your dotfiles on the internet can have a lot of advantages but can become a huge pain if you’re not careful.

item.title: Elixir ExUnit.DocTest
item.description: Have you ever been frustrated by the lack working examples in documentation? Elixir helps solve this problem with a built in feature called DocTest.

item.title: Hello Blog
item.description: I’ve tried to start this blog at least 20 times over the past few years so here we go…
